title: People of India , What are your opinion on philosophy of Georgism (Free Land, Free trade , Free man) ?
selftext:
I think this post can be considered under Policy/Economy but please correct me if I had to do some other flair like political since Economy and politics are very correlated?  


Basically Henry George was awesome guy in america who was also third most famous guy in america at that time after I think einstein and thomas ford (I suppose?)

He wrote a book called progress and poverty which I am going to read after sometime. In that George talked about a philosophy of Georgism.

I came to know about georgism but I think most Indians don't know about it. I saw some recent posts on r/IndiaTax with the frustation of tax and I think that India should maybe follow some other basic tax system but that is not the topic of today's discussion.  


Here is the definition of Georgism according to wikipedia.   


>**Georgism**, also called in modern times **Geoism**,[\[3\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-4) and known historically as the **single tax movement**, is an [economic ideology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_ideology) holding that people should own the value that they produce themselves, while the [economic rent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_rent) derived from [land](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_(economics))—including from all [natural resources](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_resources), the [commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commons), and urban locations—should belong equally to all members of society.[\[5\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-Heavey-6)[\[7\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-7) Developed from the writings of American economist and social reformer [Henry George](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_George), the Georgist paradigm seeks solutions to [social](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_issue) and [ecological problems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecological_problems), based on principles of land rights and public finance that attempt to integrate [economic efficiency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_efficiency) with [social justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_justice).[\[8\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-8)[\[9\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgism#cite_note-9) 

Basically it means that there is only one tax which is on land. I know this sounds a bit weird but young generation can agree with me that we are unable to own housing because of corruption / black money and other reasons.. , most farmers are working in disguised unemployed in farming sector but are still doing it.. , I think georgism can make them increase their efficiency . Georgism isn't socialist but rather a free trade movement. Maybe instead of having no taxes other than land , we can decrease the taxes very much on things other than land to nominal like 5-6% while focus on land rent till 10-12% ? This way a lot of overvaluation of land might also be able to decrease.   


Really interested to hear your thoughts
comments:
It doesn't take off cause all the richest and most powerful people in the land are also the biggest collectors of rent. You can imagine how the stories goes when someone tells them - hello we need some off that rent you are collecting. 

Banking system also benefits from low land tax/property tax cause a big source of their income is mortgages. And they play a big role in making cash flow towards areas with least land/rent tax. 

So if you can find a way to get rid of the banks then you might have a shot.
Westan ekaanami kennot bi blindly applied to India /s

Banks get a lot of money out of home loans. If home valuations fall because of the land value tax, there will be a ripple effect in the economy. 

However, I do appreciate the idea of a land value tax and think it needs to happen. Unfortunately, the ones to lose money in such a tax are the ones with the most power, so it aint happening unless there is a mass revolution for its favour.
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry\_George](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_George) This guy , he was one of the most influential man in his time. He wrote progress and poverty.

Yup , it ain't happening but who said we can't revolt ? Americans are already thinking because of their sky high rent prices and taxes. We are getting pissed by taxes even more than americans while at the same time there is virtually not much being done with those taxes simply because the poor and rich don't pay much taxes but the middle class does. 

So basically we are getting f\* by all holes , We need to be radical to get even a bit of conservation change.

Currently the govt. has put 0% tax on agriculture produce , I think this needs to change. It would only impact the big players of agriculture which is nice. Another thing is to have inheritance tax on land (I think) . For start , we could have this tax on the rich people and later on introduce it to the poor while at the same time to decrease gst on things like books / medical / research instruments.
